articles.content:
To be silent is to be complicit. Black lives matter. 
We have a platform, and we have a duty to our Black members, employees, creators and talent to speak up.
— Netflix (@netflix) May 30, 2020

articles.title: Inequality in America was huge before the pandemic. The stock market is making it worse
articles.description: The gap between the world's rich and poor is expected to grow due to the pandemic, and a stock market high on government and central bank cash bears much of the blame.
articles.content:
A rising stock market, especially at a time of high unemployment and stagnant labor incomes, will disproportionately benefit richer households,"
Eswar Prasad, Cornell University economist
